meanings.definition: The point in the orbit of a celestial body at which it is farthest from the sun.
meanings.sent1: During its journey, the planet reaches its apsides where it is farthest from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The apsides of Earth's orbit play a crucial role in its seasonal changes.
meanings.sent3: The planet decided to throw a party at its apsides, celebrating the distance from the sun.
meanings.sent4: At the apsides of its orbit, the planet feels like a rebellious teenager, pushing away from the sun.
meanings.sent5: The apsides mark the extreme points of the planet's dance around the sun.

meanings.definition: The point in the orbit of a satellite at which it is farthest from the body around which it revolves.
meanings.sent1: The satellite's communication is weakest at its apsides when it's farthest from the main body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the behavior of satellites at their apsides to understand their orbits better.
meanings.sent3: The satellite threw a tiny party at its apsides, enjoying the solitude away from the main body.
meanings.sent4: At the apsides of its orbit, the satellite feels like a lone traveler in the vastness of space.
meanings.sent5: The apsides of the satellite's orbit mark the moments of maximum distance from the main body.
